page.title: 17The pier,Torridon
page.content: There is a small jetty at Torridon that is used for small boats to dock and anchor. These are chiefly small sailing yachts,dinghies,rowing boats and cabin cruisers,which are owned both by local people and visitors.The small boats of the local static gear fishermen also come in here. Local people collect edible winkles; these are left at the pier for the buyers to collect by lorry. Once gathered the winkles are left in open mesh bags below high tide line as they must be covered with sea water at intervals to keep them alive.There are no houses beyond the jetty;Vehicles use it as a turning place as the road is narrow,single track.There are fords marked on the map,but these are not used much now as the road bridges them However,the line and crossing places of these fords can still be seen.
